entry.title: jank development update - Object model results

link.title: jank development update - Object model results

entry.summary: As summer draws to a close, in the Pacific Northwest, so too does my term of sponsored work focused on a faster object model for jank. Thanks so much to Clojurists Together for funding jank's development. The past quarter has been quite successful and I'm excited to share the results.

entry.title: jank development update - A faster object model

link.title: jank development update - A faster object model

entry.summary: This quarter, my work on jank is being sponsored by Clojurists Together. The terms of the work are to research a new object model for jank, with the goal of making jank code faster across the board. This is a half-way report and I'm excited to share my results!

entry.title: jank development update - Optimizing a ray tracer

link.title: jank development update - Optimizing a ray tracer

entry.summary: After the last post, which focused on optimizing jank's sequences, I wanted to get jank running a ray tracer I had previously written in Clojure. In this post, I document what was required to start ray tracing in jank and, more importantly, how I chased down the run time in a fierce battle with Clojure's performance.

entry.title: jank development update - Optimizing sequences
entry.summary: In this episode of jank's development updates, we follow an exciting few weekends as I was digging deep into Clojure's sequence implementation, building jank's equivalent, and then benchmarking and profiling in a dizzying race to the bottom.

entry.title: jank development update - Lots of new changes

link.title: jank development update - Lots of new changes

entry.summary: I was previously giving updates only in the #jank Slack channel, but some of these are getting large enough to warrant more prose. Thus, happily, I can announce that jank has a new blog and I have a lot of new progress to report! Let's get into the details.
